class.name: VirtualDevice
class.brief_description: A base class for all on-screen virtual input devices.
class.description: [VirtualDevice] serves as the foundation for creating on-screen input controls like joysticks, buttons, and D-pads. It inherits from [Control], enabling layout and theming. Use this class as a base if you want to implement custom virtual input devices. It handles basic touch state management (pressed, hovered) and output device indexing.

method.name: get_draw_mode
method.description: Returns the current visual state of the device (normal, pressed, hovered, etc.), useful for custom drawing logic.

method.name: is_pressed
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the device is currently being touched or clicked.

members.member: The device index to be used in the generated [InputEvent]. For example, if set to 0, events will appear as "Device 0".
Controls when the virtual device is visible. Can be set to show always or only on touchscreen devices.

constants.constant: The device is only visible if the [DisplayServer] supports touch input.
